name: Greedy algorithm
description: An algorithm that finds a solution by always picking the currently best looking option without thinking too much about past and future decisions.

name: Israeli Queue
description: A type of priority queue and a reference to the infamously unorganized queues in Israel. Here items come first when they already have "friends waiting in line".

name: Stack
description: Like with a stack of pancakes you can only add and remove items from the top of this data structure.

name: Tree
description: A hierarchically organized data structure. From the root item the other items branch out into nodes and leaves.

name: Queue
description: In this data structure items are always added at the end and removed at the front as if the items were waiting in line.

name: Adapter
description: Allows classes with incompatible interfaces to work together by wrapping its own interface around that of an already existing class.

name: Facade
description: Analogous to a facade in architecture, a facade is an object that serves as a front-facing interface masking more complex underlying structure.

name: Promise
description: A representation of a result that is available in the future, unless there are errors. Like in reality, promises are broken sometimes.

name: Shotgun surgery
description: A programming anitpattern where in a single change you wildly add code everywhere in your codebase.

name: fold
description: Like a blanket being folded up, this function iterates a collection and in each step combines the current item with everything that has already been folded.

name: trampoline
description: Continuously runs functions which itself return functions. Like a child on a trampoline that returns and bounces back up.

name: zip
description: Merges two lists into one list of pairs like the interlocking teeth of a zipper.

name: Backdoor
description: A method of bypassing normal authentication in a computer system.

name: Computer virus
description: A computer program that self replicates by infecting other computer programs similar to the behavior of biological viruses.

name: Cyber hygiene
description: Steps and practices that users should take to maintain system health and improve online security.

name: Honeypot
description: Part of a system meant to look like an attractive target but actually helps detect and deflect attackers.

name: Phoning home
description: When a system (e.g. stolen computer) secretly reports back to a third party other than the current possessor. The name is a reference to the movie E.T.

name: Sandbox
description: A safe and isolated environment to test unverified programs that may contain malicious code.

name: Trojan horse
description: Malware which misleads users of its true intent. The term is derived from the Ancient Greek story of the deceptive Trojan Horse.

name: clooney
description: A JavaScript library implementing the actor model for concurrent computation. The term is a reference to George Clooney who is also an actor.

name: uppy
description: A dog themed uploader component. The name is a blend of upload and puppy. It even comes with a crash recovery plugin called golden retreiver.

name: Breadcrumb
description: Navigational aid allowing users to keep track of their location within programs, documents, or websites. The term is a reference to the fairy tale Hansel and Gretel.

name: Carousel
description: A kind of animated slideshow looping back on itself.

name: Desktop
description: The metaphorical top of the user's desk, upon which objects such as documents and folders of documents can be placed.

name: Hamburger button
description: A button to toggle a menu. The associated icon resembles a hamburger.

name: Clique problem
description: The problem of finding groups of mutual friends in a network of people with friendship relations. Or more general, finding complete subgraphs.

name: ACID vs. BASE
description: Acronyms describing competing database ideologies (aka. SQL vs. NoSQL).

name: camelCase, snake_case, kebab-case
description: Different case styles where the name illustrates its appearance.

name: Easter egg
description: A hidden feature especially in video games in reference to the Easter egg hunt.

name: Glue Code
description: Jenga and LEGO bricks don't share the same interface but you can always glue them together.

name: Lazy evaluation
description: An evaluation stategy which suspends evaluation until it's absolutly necessary and then never does it again.

name: Optimistic UI
description: User interfaces that assume expensive operations will complete successfully thereby improving the perceived performance.

name: Process starvation
description: A problem where a process is perpetually denied resources to do its work.

name: Time travel debugging
description: Stepping back in time through source code to understand execution and sometimes even to change history.
